customer_addr:
312 Pleasant Valley Rd SW
Sugarcreek, OH 44681

citations.narrative:
Three outdoor enclosures that contain 7 adult dogs had sharp points present. The three outdoor enclosures had barbed
wire along the top and bottom of the enclosure perimeter fencing. Some areas of the barbed wire along the bottom of the
fencing were sagging and partially buried adding additional hazards. Failure to ensure that primary enclosures do not
contain sharp points can lead to injury in the animals. The applicant must ensure that primary enclosures do not contain
sharp edges or points that could injure the dogs.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 14-October-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.6(a)(2)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Three outdoor enclosures that contain 7 adult dogs had sharp points present. The three outdoor enclosures had barbed 
wire along the top and bottom of the enclosure perimeter fencing. Some areas of the barbed wire along the bottom of the 
fencing were sagging and partially buried adding additional hazards. Failure to ensure that primary enclosures do not 
contain sharp points can lead to injury in the animals. The applicant must ensure that primary enclosures do not contain 
sharp edges or points that could injure the dogs. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 14-October-2024 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
